stop.instruction: Stop completely and check traffic before proceeding.
stop.rule: Failure to stop may incur fines and points on your license.
stop.fact: Stop signs follow standardized designs in many countries (Vienna Convention).

yield.instruction: Slow down and give priority to traffic on the major road.
yield.rule: Yield to vehicles on the main road and pedestrians.
yield.fact: Yield signs are often triangular and indicate priority rules.

no_entry.instruction: Do not enter this road or lane from your direction.
no_entry.rule: Entering a no-entry zone is a traffic offense.
no_entry.fact: No entry signs protect one-way streets and restricted areas.

speed_limit_20.instruction: Reduce speed to 20 km/h or below.
speed_limit_20.rule: Obey posted speed limits; penalties apply for violations.
speed_limit_20.fact: Lower speed limits are common in residential and school zones.

speed_limit_30.instruction: Maintain speed at or below 30 km/h.
speed_limit_30.rule: Speeding fines increase with the severity of the excess.
speed_limit_30.fact: 30 km/h zones improve pedestrian safety in urban areas.

speed_limit_50.instruction: Keep your speed at or below 50 km/h.
speed_limit_50.rule: Observe variable and temporary speed limit signage.
speed_limit_50.fact: Speed limits often change at town boundaries.

turn_right.instruction: Prepare to make a right turn; signal and give way where required.
turn_right.rule: Use indicators and keep to lane discipline while turning.
turn_right.fact: Turn signs can be mandatory or advisory depending on design.

turn_left.instruction: Prepare for a left turn; check mirrors and signal appropriately.
turn_left.rule: Yield to oncoming traffic if there is no protected turn signal.
turn_left.fact: Protected turns reduce conflict at busy intersections.

roundabout.instruction: Slow down and give way to circulating traffic.
roundabout.rule: Enter the roundabout only when safe; follow lane markings.
roundabout.fact: Roundabouts reduce severe collisions compared to signalized junctions.

pedestrian_crossing.hi: पैदल यात्री पार करने का स्थान
pedestrian_crossing.instruction: Stop for pedestrians on the crossing and do not overtake stopped vehicles.
pedestrian_crossing.rule: Pedestrians have right of way on marked crossings in many jurisdictions.
pedestrian_crossing.fact: Zebra crossings use high-visibility markings to slow traffic.

school_zone.instruction: Drive slowly and watch for children; observe reduced speed limits.
school_zone.rule: Strict speed enforcement often applies during school hours.
school_zone.fact: School zones are common places for increased pedestrian activity.

no_overtaking.instruction: Do not overtake other vehicles until the restriction ends.
no_overtaking.rule: Overtaking in prohibited zones can lead to fines and license points.
no_overtaking.fact: No-overtake zones are placed where visibility is limited.

slippery_road.instruction: Reduce speed and avoid sudden maneuvers.
slippery_road.rule: Drive at speeds appropriate for road conditions.
slippery_road.fact: Oil or rain can create temporary slippery surfaces.

road_work.instruction: Slow down, follow temporary signs and workers' directions.
road_work.rule: Obey temporary speed limits and lane closures.
road_work.fact: Work zones often have reduced speeds and narrow lanes.

priority_road.instruction: You have the right of way until the end-of-priority sign.
priority_road.rule: Priority roads give vehicles precedence over side roads.
priority_road.fact: Marked by a yellow diamond sign in many countries.

end_of_restriction.instruction: Normal traffic rules resume; previous restrictions no longer apply.
end_of_restriction.rule: Be aware that speed or overtaking limits may be lifted.
end_of_restriction.fact: Often shown with diagonal stripes across the original prohibitory sign.

keep_left.instruction: Keep to the left side of the traffic island or divider.
keep_left.rule: Obey lane direction signs to avoid head-on conflicts.
keep_left.fact: Used to direct traffic around medians or obstacles.

no_parking.instruction: Do not park vehicles here; loading/unloading may also be restricted.
no_parking.rule: Violating parking restrictions can lead to fines or towing.
no_parking.fact: No parking signs are distinct from no stopping / no standing signs.

hospital.instruction: Reduce noise and give priority to ambulances.
hospital.rule: Avoid blocking access routes to medical facilities.
hospital.fact: Hospital signs alert drivers to vulnerable pedestrians and emergency vehicles.

bicycle_crossing.instruction: Watch for cyclists and give way when required.
bicycle_crossing.rule: Cyclists may use marked crossings similar to pedestrians.
bicycle_crossing.fact: Dedicated cycle infrastructure reduces conflicts with motor traffic.

children.instruction: Drive slowly and be alert for children entering the road.
children.rule: Extra caution required in residential and school areas.
children.fact: These signs are placed near playgrounds, schools and parks.

merge.instruction: Adjust speed to merge safely and signal when changing lanes.
merge.rule: Drivers must make room for merging traffic where required.
merge.fact: Merge signs reduce sudden lane changes and improve flow.

two_way_traffic.instruction: Be aware of oncoming vehicles; stay within your lane.
two_way_traffic.rule: Keep left/right as per local driving side regulations.
two_way_traffic.fact: Often posted when a one-way road ends or narrows.
